api_app_id.description: Use this to distinguish which app the event belongs to if you use multiple apps with the same Request URL.
api_app_id.title: The unique identifier your installed Slack application.

authed_users.title: An array of string-based User IDs. Each member of the collection represents a user that has installed your application/bot and indicates the described event would be visible to those users.

type.title: The specific name of the event

event.title: The actual event, an object, that happened

x-examples.text: How many cats did we herd yesterday?

event_id.title: A unique identifier for this specific event, globally unique across all workspaces.

event_time.title: The epoch timestamp in seconds indicating when this event was dispatched.

team_id.title: The unique identifier of the workspace where the event occurred

token.title: A verification token to validate the event originated from Slack

type.title: Indicates which kind of event dispatch this is, usually `event_callback`

GenericEventWrapper.title: Standard event wrapper for the Events API

info.description: A webhook-based events bus using a subscription model for Slack apps
info.title: Slack Events API

servers.description: A pre-registered Request URL on servers you control where subscriptions will be delivered.

request_url.description: Your chosen request URL where events will be delivered.

servers.description: Your Slack app management console's event subscription configurator. Visit in a web browser and sign in to your workspace.

slack_app_id.description: Your Slack app's unique identifier, found in the URL when editing your app on api.slack.com.

tags.description: Events less about a workspace and more about your app
tags.name: app_event

tags.description: Part of workspace app's Permissions API
tags.name: permissions_api

tags.description: User token based apps can subscribe to this event
tags.name: allows_user_tokens

tags.description: Workspace token apps can subscribe to this event
tags.name: allows_workspace_tokens
